title: Understanding the Reaction
text: The reaction given is the combustion of methanol: CH₃OH(l)+3/2 O₂(g) $$=$$ CO₂(g)+2H₂O(l).

title: Using Enthalpy of Formation
text: The standard enthalpy change of a reaction (ΔHrxn°) can be calculated using the enthalpies of formation: ΔHrxn° $$=$$ ΣΔHf°(products) - ΣΔHf°(reactants).

title: Calculate Products' Enthalpy
text: Calculate the total enthalpy of formation for the products: CO₂(g) and 2H₂O(l). Use the values: ΔHf°[CO₂(g)] $$=$$ $$-393.5$$ $$\frac{kJ}{mol}$$ and ΔHf°[H₂O(l)] $$=$$ $$-285.8$$ $$\frac{kJ}{mol}$$.

title: Calculate Reactants' Enthalpy
text: Calculate the total enthalpy of formation for the reactants: CH₃OH(l) and $$\frac{3}{2}$$ O₂(g). Remember that ΔHf°[O₂(g)] $$=$$ $$0$$ $$\frac{kJ}{mol}$$.

title: Solve for Unknown Enthalpy
text: Rearrange the equation to solve for ΔHf°[CH₃OH(l)]: ΔHf°[CH₃OH(l)] $$=$$ ΣΔHf°(products) - ΔHrxn° - ΣΔHf°(O₂(g)).
